lead_paragraph: The legislators have not had a pay increase since 1999, and now three appointees of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo declined to back one without new ethics laws.

byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Vivian Yee from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and VIVIAN YEE

headline.print_headline: Cuomo Appointees Dash Lawmakers’ Hopes for Raise
headline.main: New York Lawmakers Will Not Get Raise, Commission Decides

snippet: The legislators have not had a pay increase since 1999, and now three appointees of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo declined to back one without new ethics laws....
abstract: New York State Commission on Legislative, Judicial and Executive Compensation declines to support raise for legislators, dashing hopes for first raise in two years; says decision is tied to ongoing ethics problems in Albany and raise will come only if Legislature holds special session before year's end aimed at passing law to limit lawmakers' outside income.
